item.title: 75/L12 – Asea
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Asea Christ the man gives up everything he holds into the plastic bowl. Sudden boundary of his new world. He learns the intimate smell of himself. All night long he rides nausea as a sailor, breathing deep through the valleys, … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Asea

Christ the man gives up
everything he holds
into the plastic bowl.
Sudden boundary
of his new world.
He learns the intimate
smell of himself.
All night long he rides
nausea as a sailor,
breathing deep
through the valleys,
but the sudden twist within
will not be quelled.
No calm sea, no sleep.
On the raft of sheets
the world goes by. Sidewalk
voices, music from next door
filter from another world.
One’s will he begins
to understand isn’t always
what is done. The body taken
from the mind: acrid taste
of what’s to come.

item.title: 74/L11 – Selfie
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Selfie Christ the man poses on an empty pier, alone but for the waves. His right arm cranes away, angling to swallow the whole Pacific rolled out behind, his face forever imposed upon it. Salted wind and crying gulls will … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Selfie

Christ the man poses
on an empty pier,
alone but for the waves.
His right arm cranes away,
angling to swallow the whole
Pacific rolled out behind,
his face forever imposed upon it.
Salted wind and crying gulls
will not appear. No proof
of the thousand steps
smothered beneath the surf.
A clutch of pale sand scooped
into a jar meant for preserves;
a pearled shell the home
of some vanished body;
bits of pale blue glass
smooth as water.
These he keeps for the mantle altar.
The cock-eyed image of Christ
the man, awkward icon,
badly lit and out of focus,
taped to his morning mirror.
The face looking back
at the face, as into a sea
unending.

item.title: 73/L10 – Fruit
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Fruit Christ the man swallows a rusty bit of wind-fall apple nestled in the weeds. Its flesh takes on his teeth. He waits. The day is digging itself a grave, warm and soiled in late summer. Grasshoppers flit and he … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Fruit

Christ the man swallows
a rusty bit of wind-fall
apple nestled in the weeds.
Its flesh takes on his teeth.
He waits. The day is digging
itself a grave, warm and soiled
in late summer. Grasshoppers
flit and he thinks of eyelids
in the midst of dreams.
The apple has yellowed
of its own accord, mealing over
in his hand. Rot’s a thing
to see up close, he says,
but not endure. He eats it
whole, brittle core and bitter
pips in turn. The stem he saves,
a tiny flag to prick his hand
on the long road home,
remind him of the sweetness
and the sacrifice.

item.title: 72/L9 – Tabernacle
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Tabernacle Christ the man stalks the Jos. A Banks store at the mall, slipping in and out of the expensive and inexpensive suits on his lunch break. He’s come to love the weight and glide of silk and nylon against … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Tabernacle

Christ the man stalks
the Jos. A Banks store
at the mall, slipping in
and out of the expensive
and inexpensive suits
on his lunch break.
He’s come to love
the weight and glide
of silk and nylon
against his skin.
Cool blue pin-stripes,
the gray houndstooth
of his eyes. The swish
of fabric on the rack.
A sabeled leather smell imbues
the salesman’s quiet canting,
weaving a holy space.
The appointed hour comes;
he exits quiet as he came. Leaving
the jacket void, formless
without his shape to hold,
hung again with care
upon a wooden hanger.

item.title: 71/L8 – Witness
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Witness Christ the man sobs with such luxuriant abandon it sets the neighbor dogs to. Kitchen conversations pause and lawn mowers sputter dead. Afternoon passers-by tent hands as shade for eyes in witness of this front-porch unraveling. The sound is … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Witness

Christ the man sobs
with such luxuriant abandon
it sets the neighbor dogs to.
Kitchen conversations pause
and lawn mowers sputter dead.
Afternoon passers-by tent
hands as shade for eyes
in witness of this front-porch
unraveling. The sound is a
lamentation not wholly born.
His beer bottle sweats a ring
on the stoop in solidarity
while the flower bed,
freshly mulched and turned
as somewhere church choirs sang,
gives off the warming smell
of promise. He wipes his nose
and red-eyed sees the small
part of his world–ordered
streets, a litany of jays, the dogs
given to their lounging, quiet now
–and knows that it is good.

item.title: 70/L7 – Standard
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Standard Christ the man finds the frayed edge of himself, seamless garment torn. A flag in high wind. No sharp yell or recoil, just simple act of will: steady bending. The contortions required to keep it close and whole come … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Standard

Christ the man finds
the frayed edge
of himself, seamless
garment torn. A flag
in high wind. No sharp
yell or recoil, just simple
act of will: steady bending.
The contortions required
to keep it close and whole
come natural, though
not without cost. He learns
a certain grimace, a cast
of mouth and eye. Unbidden
others come to mind: flayed
garments, bodies broken
and individual, each bearing
their banner aloft, fluttering
in some ungentle breeze.

item.title: 69/L6 – Letter
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Letter Christ the man kisses the blood from the slim cut and envelope’s sticky lip. Tastes iron. Spoons bloom in his mind. All day long he feels the thumb in a new way: distinct in pain, alert to the limits … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Letter

Christ the man kisses
the blood from the slim cut
and envelope’s sticky lip.
Tastes iron. Spoons bloom
in his mind. All day long
he feels the thumb in a new way:
distinct in pain, alert
to the limits healing has.
The disconcerting absence of feeling
a band-aid makes possible.
Each painful throb reminds him
of the letter sent, lost
in a sharp, shuffling sea of letters,
also lost, bearing out into the world
the red stamp of his hand.

item.title: 68/L5 – Throne
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Throne Christ the man brushes robin’s egg blue on in calm strokes, a sea covering the chair rescued from obscurity. Planed and oiled over many nights, returned to former glory. A chair joined so precise, its many curved pieces fitted … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Throne

Christ the man
brushes robin’s egg
blue on in calm strokes,
a sea covering the chair
rescued from obscurity.
Planed and oiled over
many nights, returned
to former glory. A chair
joined so precise,
its many curved pieces
fitted as one body, turned
from bitten, slivered wood
to shining second life.
The work of his hands
set out on a front porch
to weather wind and rain,
to hold him in contemplation
of the world
he finds before him.

item.title: 67/L4 – Supper
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Supper Christ the man keeps it simple: snap peas from the vine, green onions, back-porch mint torn by the rough handful. Tossed with a little oil, dash of salt. A glass of wine. His knife sings its thanks to the … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Supper

Christ the man
keeps it simple:
snap peas from the vine,
green onions, back-porch mint
torn by the rough handful.
Tossed with a little oil,
dash of salt. A glass of wine.
His knife sings
its thanks to the fork
over the ready plate
rimmed in gold. Oil
graces his beard
glinting in the sun.

item.title: 66/L3 – Ablution
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Ablution Christ the man caught in morning light, filtered through thin eggshell scrim of plastic netting day’s first-born thoughts. Water warms. Steam spirits his voice out of his breast collects cascading in alabaster, beads intimate on olive wood skin. He … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Ablution

Christ the man caught
in morning light, filtered
through thin eggshell
scrim of plastic netting
day’s first-born thoughts.
Water warms. Steam spirits
his voice out of his breast
collects cascading in alabaster,
beads intimate on olive wood
skin. He knows the deep
bend behind the knees,
the particular crooked
point of elbow. Water
pours out and out
as he counts every hair
on his right hand, engrossed
in the intricacy of flesh.
